name: 餐旅設施規劃與設計
description:
This course introduces concepts and practices needed to plan, design and manage hospitality facilities profitably. The course contains three main topics: (a) a feasibility study, which is normally conducted by the developers to analyze the market situation and confirm the potential return and financial performance; (b) project management, which involves the coordination of a project��s construction process to ensure the project is delivered on time, on budget and at the proper level of quality; and (c) hotel design considerations. At the completion of this course, students should be able to:

1. Know the framework and models through which the development of hospitality facilities is accomplished

2. Know the major planning and design considerations for hospitality facilities

3. Understand the key factor affecting a construction project management 

4. Form judgments on typical development and planning decisions
goals: Understand the framework and models through which the development of hospitality facilities is accomplished
Recognize the major planning and design considerations for hospitality facilities
Identify the key factor affecting a construction project management
Form judgments on typical development and planning decisions

本課程介紹以盈利為目的來規劃、設計和管理餐旅業營運所需的概念和實務。 課程包含三個主要主題： (a) 可行性研究：通常由開發商進行，以分析市場情況並確認潛在回報和財務表現； (b) 專案管理：包括協調餐旅設施投資項目的施工過程，以確保項目按時、按預算交付，並達到適當的質量標準； (c) 酒店設計考慮。

完成本課程後，學生應該能夠：

1\. 了解餐旅設施開發的框架和模型

2\. 了解餐旅設施的主要規劃和設計注意事項

3\. 了解影響建築專案管理的關鍵因素

4\. 對典型的開發和規劃決策做出判斷決策

methodologies.note: Lectures on the frameworks and models that can be used for marketing, financial, construction and design decisions on the hospitality facilities development projects.
Two cases based on real hotels will be used in the class to allow the students apply what they have learned in the classroom and textbooks to real business cases.
The students learn how to work in a group setting through the semester project.
A field trip to a hotel will be arranged for the students to explore special hotel design features.
A group semester project is arranged to allow the students to conduct a feasibility study on a fictitious hotel and design the hotel.

grading.note: There will be two real hotel investment case studies. The students are required to write a case report for each case to answer the given case question before the in-class case discussion.
Participating in the in-class case discussion.
Attend the class on time each week and be prepared to ask and answer questions.
